column4: hi could you tell me what this means:  josh@:/dev$ setserial /dev/ttyS0 autoconfig
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
try "sudo setserial /dev/ttyS0 autoconfig"  you probably just dont have permissions as a reuglar user
na i get the same thing
not sure, check dmesg
segfaults are usually software problems like bugs
any errors or "segfault" reports
maybe a driver is having an issue
but i dont know specifically
not errors in it and it also has no mention of ttyS*
it had no errors in it and has notmention of ttyS 0,1,2,or 3
post your dmesg in pastebin
here you go :   http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/40489/
nothing bad that i can see, but what is your end goal?
trying to get my finepoint tablet pc to work (using fpit drivers)
sorry i dont think i can help with that
#linux though if you cant find anyone here who can help you w/ it
sorry i dont know really what is wrong with your ttyS0
any other good channels for hlep?
try #linux ?
you probably have to be patient.  just have to find someone who knows.
